benchmark_details.name: Cognitive-Mental-LLM: Evaluating Reasoning in Large Language Models for Mental Health Prediction via Online Text
benchmark_details.overview: This study provides a comprehensive benchmark of reasoning-based LLM techniques for mental health text classification, evaluating their effectiveness across five benchmark datasets: Dreaddit, CSSRS, SDCNL, DepSeverity, and RedSam.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate structured reasoning techniques in mental health text classification and improve interpretability and accuracy in predictions.

data.source: Datasets include Dreaddit, CSSRS, SDCNL, DepSeverity, and RedSam, sourced from previous studies and aggregated annotations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on true positives, true negatives, false positives, and false negatives.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in the accuracy metrics suggest better model performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison with baseline models such as BERT, RoBERTa, and prior study models.
